intro: Rodriguezia joesiana, commonly known as the Joesiana tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the mango and cashew. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces edible fruits that are often consumed by local communities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
